protocol.text: One-week-old seedlings grown on vertical MS plates were treated by touching the root/crown region by a toothpick containing mycelia from R. solani grown on PDA. At the same time, GSTF8::luciferase transgenic plants were grown on MS plates with luciferin, and luciferase activity was measured at day 0, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 10 days. Based on a measurement of maximum GSTF8::luciferase activity, whole seedlings were collected seven days after treatment. Three biological replicates were used for each treatment.
Col-0 seedlings were grown on vertical MS plates.

Three biological repeats of 100mg seedling tissue from the non-infected control, AG8- and AG2-1-treated plants were obtained. RNA was extracted using the Qiagen RNA easy kit following the manufacturerâ€™s protocol.

Whole plant RNA (15ug for each sample) was sent to the Australian Genome Research Facility Ltd. (Melbourne, Victoria, Australia) for labelling. Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from 2 ug total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).

cRNA was hybridized to the GeneChip Arabidopsis ATH1 Genome Array using a GeneChip instrument system with scanner 3000 7G and autoloader for expression array processing and analysis, following the manufacturer's protocol. Hybridization was performed at the Australian Genome Research Facility Ltd. (Melbourne, Victoria, Australia).
GeneChips were scanned on an Affymetrix GeneChip scanner 3000 7G.

The raw data files underwent background correction, normalization, probe specific correction, and summary value computation using the Robust Multichip Average (RMA) method in the Bioconductor package.
